programme.title: The Patriot
Der Patriot
programme.desc:
The Patriot: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs. Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0187393/","name":"The Patriot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjE4ODU0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTI2OTk2._V1_.jpg","description":"Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0187393/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JamesHitchcock"},"dateCreated":"2007-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heroes and Villains","reviewBody":""The Patriot", the story of an American farmer who fights in the War of Independence, is sometimes used, together with "Braveheart", as evidence of a supposed anti-British prejudice on the part of Mel Gibson. This is perhaps unfair to Gibson, who has gone on record as supporting the ties between Australia and the British monarchy (hardly the stance of a Brit-hating bigot). Although "Braveheart", which he produced and directed, was very much Gibson's own pet project, he was neither the producer, director or scriptwriter of "The Patriot". Indeed, he was not even first choice to play the lead. The producers originally wanted Harrison Ford who turned the part down, reportedly because he felt that the script turned the American Revolution into the story of one man's quest for revenge.

Because of its anti-British stance, the film was badly received in Britain. One newspaper accused it of blackening the character of the British officer Banastre Tarleton who served as the inspiration for the villainous Colonel Tavington. One commentator went so far as to say that it was the sort of film that the Nazis might have made about the American Revolution had they won World War II. Unlike some of my fellow-countrymen, I was not too worried about this aspect of the film. The total death toll in the American War of Independence was remarkably low, not only by modern standards but even by the standards of other wars of this era, such as the Napoleonic War. Nevertheless, in every war ever fought there have been crimes on both sides, and the War of Independence was no exception. (The rebels could be as ruthless as the British, but none of their atrocities are shown in this film). Some of the deeds attributed to Tavington may be fictitious, such as the church-burning scene, but in real life Tarleton had a well-deserved reputation for brutality, and was not only loathed by the American colonists but also distrusted by his own side. In the film the British commander Lord Cornwallis is shown as outwardly gentlemanly and honourable, but prepared secretly to countenance Tavington's methods. In reality, Cornwallis wanted to have Tarleton court-martialled; Tarleton was only saved by his influential connections.

I did, however, have some reservations about the way these events were portrayed. It was originally intended to make the film about Francis Marion, a real-life figure. Unfortunately Marion, although undoubtedly courageous and a skilled guerrilla leader, was also a slave-owner (as any landowner of substance in 1770s South Carolina would have been) and was therefore deemed unworthy to be the hero of a modern blockbuster (even though a TV series about him was made in the fifties). His exploits, therefore, are credited to a fictitious "Benjamin Martin". The slavery issue could have been avoided by moving the action to, say, New England, but instead the film gives us a wholly unrealistic picture of race relations in the period. The black workers on Martin's land are all free men, and black and white live together in harmony, with black soldiers willingly fighting alongside whites in the Continental Army. This sort of dishonest, idealised portrayal of slavery was at one time common in films like "Gone with the Wind", but I thought that it had died out with the growth of the Civil Rights movement.

(Incidentally, a reason why so many Southerners supported the revolutionaries was that slavery had been declared illegal in Britain itself in 1771 and they feared that the British Parliament would eventually legislate to ban it in the colonies. Needless to say, there is no mention of this attitude in the film. In later life Tarleton became MP for Liverpool, and a vehement defender of slavery. In this, if in nothing else, he and Marion had something in common).

My other reservation about the film's political stance is similar to Ford's. The film probably concentrated so heavily on British brutality because it is difficult to interest a modern audience, even an American audience, in the actual reasons why the war was fought. It is easy to make out an intellectual case for the principle of "no taxation without representation", which had been part of British constitutional thought since at least the Civil War in the 1640s. It is much less easy to justify the spilling of blood in defence of that principle, and Martin, scarred by his experiences in the French and Indian Wars, is originally shown as a pacifist, unwilling to fight or to support the Declaration of Independence which he believes will lead to war. His son Gabriel, however, joins the Continental Army, but is wrongly accused of being a spy and threatened with execution. Tavington, believing Martin to be a rebel sympathiser, burns down his home and murders another son, Thomas. Martin is forced to take up arms to defend his family and then forms a guerrilla band which he leads against the British. Despite the title of the film, however, Martin is not really motivated by patriotism; he seems less a patriot than a pacifist who has abandoned his principles in order to seek revenge.

The film is attractively photographed, although I felt that it sometimes showed a sanitised, prettified version of eighteenth-century life. In some ways it reminded me of "The Last Samurai", another visually attractive epic flawed by a dishonest approach to history and by excessive length, although I would rate it slightly higher, largely because Gibson makes a more commanding and impressive epic hero than does Tom Cruise. From the viewpoint of anyone without patriotic preconceptions, it can be seen simply as an exciting (if overlong) adventure film- my wife, who is not British by birth, was cheering on Martin and booing Tavington. Nevertheless, its approach to history never gets beyond a simplified story of heroes and villains. 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":264349,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2000-07-19","keywords":"american revolution,hero,standoff,father son relationship,george washington character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Patriot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi100139289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Touchstone Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000613/","name":"Joely Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007500/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734441/","name":"Robert Rodat"}],"duration":"PT2H45M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0187393, Title: The Patriot, --- Description: The Patriot: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs. Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0187393/","name":"The Patriot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjE4ODU0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTI2OTk2._V1_.jpg","description":"Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0187393/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"JamesHitchcock","dateCreated":"2007-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Heroes and Villains","reviewBody":""The Patriot", the story of an American farmer who fights in the War of Independence, is sometimes used, together with "Braveheart", as evidence of a supposed anti-British prejudice on the part of Mel Gibson. This is perhaps unfair to Gibson, who has gone on record as supporting the ties between Australia and the British monarchy (hardly the stance of a Brit-hating bigot). Although "Braveheart", which he produced and directed, was very much Gibson's own pet project, he was neither the producer, director or scriptwriter of "The Patriot". Indeed, he was not even first choice to play the lead. The producers originally wanted Harrison Ford who turned the part down, reportedly because he felt that the script turned the American Revolution into the story of one man's quest for revenge.

Because of its anti-British stance, the film was badly received in Britain. One newspaper accused it of blackening the character of the British officer Banastre Tarleton who served as the inspiration for the villainous Colonel Tavington. One commentator went so far as to say that it was the sort of film that the Nazis might have made about the American Revolution had they won World War II. Unlike some of my fellow-countrymen, I was not too worried about this aspect of the film. The total death toll in the American War of Independence was remarkably low, not only by modern standards but even by the standards of other wars of this era, such as the Napoleonic War. Nevertheless, in every war ever fought there have been crimes on both sides, and the War of Independence was no exception. (The rebels could be as ruthless as the British, but none of their atrocities are shown in this film). Some of the deeds attributed to Tavington may be fictitious, such as the church-burning scene, but in real life Tarleton had a well-deserved reputation for brutality, and was not only loathed by the American colonists but also distrusted by his own side. In the film the British commander Lord Cornwallis is shown as outwardly gentlemanly and honourable, but prepared secretly to countenance Tavington's methods. In reality, Cornwallis wanted to have Tarleton court-martialled; Tarleton was only saved by his influential connections.

I did, however, have some reservations about the way these events were portrayed. It was originally intended to make the film about Francis Marion, a real-life figure. Unfortunately Marion, although undoubtedly courageous and a skilled guerrilla leader, was also a slave-owner (as any landowner of substance in 1770s South Carolina would have been) and was therefore deemed unworthy to be the hero of a modern blockbuster (even though a TV series about him was made in the fifties). His exploits, therefore, are credited to a fictitious "Benjamin Martin". The slavery issue could have been avoided by moving the action to, say, New England, but instead the film gives us a wholly unrealistic picture of race relations in the period. The black workers on Martin's land are all free men, and black and white live together in harmony, with black soldiers willingly fighting alongside whites in the Continental Army. This sort of dishonest, idealised portrayal of slavery was at one time common in films like "Gone with the Wind", but I thought that it had died out with the growth of the Civil Rights movement.

(Incidentally, a reason why so many Southerners supported the revolutionaries was that slavery had been declared illegal in Britain itself in 1771 and they feared that the British Parliament would eventually legislate to ban it in the colonies. Needless to say, there is no mention of this attitude in the film. In later life Tarleton became MP for Liverpool, and a vehement defender of slavery. In this, if in nothing else, he and Marion had something in common).

My other reservation about the film's political stance is similar to Ford's. The film probably concentrated so heavily on British brutality because it is difficult to interest a modern audience, even an American audience, in the actual reasons why the war was fought. It is easy to make out an intellectual case for the principle of "no taxation without representation", which had been part of British constitutional thought since at least the Civil War in the 1640s. It is much less easy to justify the spilling of blood in defence of that principle, and Martin, scarred by his experiences in the French and Indian Wars, is originally shown as a pacifist, unwilling to fight or to support the Declaration of Independence which he believes will lead to war. His son Gabriel, however, joins the Continental Army, but is wrongly accused of being a spy and threatened with execution. Tavington, believing Martin to be a rebel sympathiser, burns down his home and murders another son, Thomas. Martin is forced to take up arms to defend his family and then forms a guerrilla band which he leads against the British. Despite the title of the film, however, Martin is not really motivated by patriotism; he seems less a patriot than a pacifist who has abandoned his principles in order to seek revenge.

The film is attractively photographed, although I felt that it sometimes showed a sanitised, prettified version of eighteenth-century life. In some ways it reminded me of "The Last Samurai", another visually attractive epic flawed by a dishonest approach to history and by excessive length, although I would rate it slightly higher, largely because Gibson makes a more commanding and impressive epic hero than does Tom Cruise. From the viewpoint of anyone without patriotic preconceptions, it can be seen simply as an exciting (if overlong) adventure film- my wife, who is not British by birth, was cheering on Martin and booing Tavington. Nevertheless, its approach to history never gets beyond a simplified story of heroes and villains. 6/10","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":264349,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2000-07-19","keywords":"american revolution,hero,standoff,father son relationship,george washington character","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Patriot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi100139289","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Touchstone Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000613/","name":"Joely Richardson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050111/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007500/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734441/","name":"Robert Rodat"],"duration":"PT2H45M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
The Da Vinci Code – Sakrileg
programme.desc:
The Da Vinci Code: Directed by Ron Howard. With Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Jean Reno. A murder inside the Louvre, and clues in Da Vinci paintings, lead to the discovery of a religious mystery protected by a secret society for two thousand years, which could shake the foundations of Christianity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0382625/","name":"The Da Vinci Code","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMjQyMTc3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTA1MDUzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A murder inside the Louvre, and clues in Da Vinci paintings, lead to the discovery of a religious mystery protected by a secret society for two thousand years, which could shake the foundations of Christianity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0382625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Flagrant-Baronessa"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best movie critic is YOU","reviewBody":"So I suggest not writing this off as a Hollywood hack film, simply because it's the bandwagon thing to do. Before you go and see The Da Vinci Code, let all the negative and positive hype surrounding this production cancel each other out, clear your mind, and judge this film fairly. Do NOT judge it on its usually weak director, do NOT judge it entirely on the source material and do NOT judge it on your religious beliefs. All this will be rewarding.

I have not read the book so I will not attempt any kind of comparison. 

Plot essentially goes like this: In the middle of the night, Professor Robert Langdon (Tom Hanks) is summoned as an expert to a crime scene in Le Louvre where a terrible murder has been committed. The victim's body is self-placed in such a bizarre, symbolic way next to one of the world's most famous paintings that the investigation gradually unlocks age-old mysteries that many do not wish to be unlocked.

The Da Vinci Code is a chilling, thrilling and well-sewn together mystery thriller that often keeps you on the edge of your seat. The cast do not disappoint either. Paul Bettany is genuinely creepy as Silas and thereby reinforces the stereotype that all albinos are evil. While Audrey Tatou is annoyingly frail as Sophie Neveu, she is captivating and lovely and is able to project both charisma and presence on screen in this film. However, Tom Hanks did not at all feel like the protagonist in the story and I am unaware whether that was intentional or not but I'm guessing no, in which case Hanks definitely fails in both attracting and keeping our interest.

So the cast usually perform well (with the exception of Hanks) and the story is also facilitated by some very striking visuals. A big plus for this film which elevates it slightly above generic formula is its beautiful locations often seen through epic aerial shots. Good call, Howard! Another big plus is its distinctly Euro-centric feel in both style and substance. This surprised me since it is Tom Hanks and Ron Howard in the same film, but they do manage to keep the overblown Hollywood clichés to a minimum. This is even apparent in the score by Hans Zimmer; it is not overblown, but subtle and appropriate in the scenes to which it was scored. Similarly, Frenchmen do not speak English with a French accent when they were alone together, but speak in French. That said, the plot does unfold in a somewhat Hollywood fashion -- and the plot happens to be thinner than an Olsen twin.

To counter the good parts, two big minuses in The Da Vinci Code are its wooden and sometimes even placeholder dialogue and its distinct lack of humor. I felt the actors were much too serious for this kind of film, which is first and foremost an adventure story, fast-paced and constantly unlocking new mysteries. The issues in the film were serious enough and needed more comedy to balance them.

As I write this review, more and more bad points about it spring to mind. This is strange, since I remember sitting in the cinema with my friends just a few hours ago and being thoroughly entertained and captivated by the whole thing. So, never mind the occasionally insultingly far-fetched plot and plot-twists by Dan Brown; The Da Vinci Code is a nicely done and very entertaining film in which nothing feels missing or incomplete.

7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":418295,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-17","keywords":"self flagellation,conspiracy,bare butt male,self punishment,bound and gagged","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Da Vinci Code","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2369847833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGVjMWI0NzUtNTYwMC00NTZkLWJiZTctZjMwMDc2ODUyMmI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGVjMWI0NzUtNTYwMC00NTZkLWJiZTctZjMwMDc2ODUyMmI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Blu-Ray trailer for this conspiracy thriller starring Tom Hanks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851582/","name":"Audrey Tautou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000606/","name":"Jean Reno"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0124737/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326040/","name":"Akiva Goldsman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1467010/","name":"Dan Brown"}],"duration":"PT2H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
Ist das Leben nicht schön?
programme.desc: It's a Wonderful Life: Directed by Frank Capra. With James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell. An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0038650/","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc4NDZhZWMtNGEzYS00ZWU2LThlM2ItNTA0YzQ0OTExMTE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwMzI2NzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0038650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brianlion"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"IT'S NOT OFFICIALLY CHRISTMAS SEASON UNTIL I WATCH THIS MOVIE","reviewBody":"I am so glad Frank Capra had a vision to make "It's A Wonderful Life". I'm glad he chose Jimmy Stewart to play George Bailey. There are some little gems in life that help make life pleasant. It is not officially the Christmas season without watching this little gem. The supporting cast is perfectly matched. Donna Reed is wonderful as well as all the characters of the town. This would be a great movie, even if it were not in a Christmas setting. The holiday flavor makes it even more charming and memorable. A angel trying to get his wings is a little far-fetched, but Capra pulls it off. The impact of living a good life cannot be underestimated. What would life be like for your family if you had never been born? Our actions do speak loudly. In an age of 9-11, we need this movie more than ever. The values of "It's A Wonderful Life" still hold true today. Yes, I'll say it, it's a wonderful movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":427383,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1947-01-07","keywords":"alternate history,small town life,guardian angel,christmas,second chance","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's a Wonderful Life","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1101988121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmUyMzVmNjgtMWQ1MS00OTkwLWEzMTktOTFlYmRiNmE1MWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000071/","name":"James Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001656/","name":"Donna Reed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000859/","name":"Lionel Barrymore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0196361/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329304/","name":"Frances Goodrich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352443/","name":"Albert Hackett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001008/","name":"Frank Capra"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: We're No Angels
Wir sind keine Engel
programme.desc: We're No Angels: Directed by Michael Curtiz. With Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray, Peter Ustinov, Joan Bennett. Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048801/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FjY2ViOWUtODk2Yi00NWJjLTgzYTQtOGQ2N2IxYzAwMmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048801/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oftenwrong"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Top notch comedy","reviewBody":"This is one of the best comedies ever and one of my all-time favorites. I must have seen it a dozen or more times. The cast is perfect and Bogart shows he has a great talent for comedy. Rathbone plays the deliciously evil antagonist Cousin Andre, perfect in his role as the villain you love to hate which he pulls off with his usual deadpan style (has he ever played the good guy in any role?) Ustinov and Ray are perfect sidekicks for Bogart, their comedic style completely complements his. Carroll is perfect as the bumbling husband of the shop the convicts descend upon, initially planning on robbing him. I found the movie had all the necessary elements for a great side-splitting comedy along with some tender moments to show a contrast in the characters involved. IMDb data; ttnr: 0048801, Title: We're No Angels, --- Description: We're No Angels: Directed by Michael Curtiz. With Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray, Peter Ustinov, Joan Bennett. Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048801/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FjY2ViOWUtODk2Yi00NWJjLTgzYTQtOGQ2N2IxYzAwMmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048801/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"oftenwrong","dateCreated":"2002-04-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Top notch comedy","reviewBody":"This is one of the best comedies ever and one of my all-time favorites. I must have seen it a dozen or more times. The cast is perfect and Bogart shows he has a great talent for comedy. Rathbone plays the deliciously evil antagonist Cousin Andre, perfect in his role as the villain you love to hate which he pulls off with his usual deadpan style (has he ever played the good guy in any role?) Ustinov and Ray are perfect sidekicks for Bogart, their comedic style completely complements his. Carroll is perfect as the bumbling husband of the shop the convicts descend upon, initially planning on robbing him. I found the movie had all the necessary elements for a great side-splitting comedy along with some tender moments to show a contrast in the characters involved. I rate this one a nine of ten.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9017,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"1955-09-08","keywords":"escaped convict,christmas,based on play,devil's island,safecracker","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1343602201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000007/","name":"Humphrey Bogart","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001811/","name":"Peter Ustinov","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712731/","name":"Aldo Ray"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002031/","name":"Michael Curtiz"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas
Der Grinch
programme.desc:
How the Grinch Stole Christmas: Directed by Ron Howard. With Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Kelley, Jeffrey Tambor. On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0170016/","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNTczNzEtMjQyZC00MjFmLTkzMDMtODk4ZGMyZmE0N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0170016/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"toffeesi"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Christmas Giggles","reviewBody":"I have just read the lead comment for this film that is on the front page with the voting results and cast run down.

Why is it that some people can not take a film for what it is supposed to be.

This film is supposed to be a light hearted, tonge in cheek, family comedy, things to make the kids laugh and things for the adults, and that is exactly what this film does.

I laughed my nuts off at this film, I thought Carey put in a great performance and the whole film (if watched at Christmas) really give you a bit of festive cheer

So to all of you film reviewers stop trying to sound like film students and knock every film because it is not "Taxi Driver" or "The Godfather" and take films for what they are supposed to be, entertainment!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":223992,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2000-12-27","keywords":"christmas,dog,dr seuss,monster,the color green","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi208601113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY3N2I2MDMtNjMwYS00ZjY3LWFmODctM2E3MmQ0Njg2YTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY3N2I2MDMtNjMwYS00ZjY3LWFmODctM2E3MmQ0Njg2YTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0597410/","name":"Taylor Momsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3679189/","name":"Kelley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049831/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317450/","name":"Dr. Seuss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0696949/","name":"Jeffrey Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780620/","name":"Peter S. Get Santa
programme.desc:
Get Santa: Directed by Christopher Smith. With Jim Broadbent, Rafe Spall, Kit Connor, Ewen Bremner. A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1935940/","name":"Get Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU0OTk3MDg1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk0MjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father and son who team up to save Christmas once they discover Santa Claus sleeping in their garage after crashing his sleigh and finding himself on the run from the police.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1935940/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"inquizitors-845-455978"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just enjoy!","reviewBody":"Some people take everything so seriously. This is a fun Christmas film that I have witnessed being enjoyed by a large group aged from 4 to 72. It is no classic but is good fun with all the characters to see the good versus bad battle. Just relax with a mince pie and your favourite tipple - or a nice cuppa - and enjoy this harmless festive fun film.

A 9-year-old boy Tom finds Santa Claus in his garden shed after Santa crashes his sleigh. Desperate to return to Lapland in time for Christmas, Santa asks Tom and his dad Steve for help. It's just a few days before Christmas, and his reindeer are found running loose through the streets of London.

Give it a watch. It is harmless fun. Jim Bradbent is a brilliant Santa and adds to his catalogue of very different roles. Rafe Spall is excellent as the dad released from prison trying to help his young son surrounded by cynical people in all guises. Kit Connor is the 9 year old boy who is the star of the movie and is excellent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2014-12-05","keywords":"santa claus,christmas,ex convict,release from prison,reindeer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Santa","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi381796121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWY1NDA4YjUtZjUzYi00YWU0LThhYmYtYzE2OTVlMzZkYmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5598573/","name":"Kit Connor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001935/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1247462/","name":"Christopher Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc:
The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sak007"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Should become a holiday classic","reviewBody":"A simple story . . . beautifully told . . . magnificently visualized.

The IMAX experience was stunning.

I did not expect to enjoy the story as much as I did. Simple but quite heartwarming.

Although it started a bit slow, it continued to gain momentum (no train analogy intended) through its conclusion. I was not a great lover of the animation of the human characters, but the other animation, whether it be the train, the scenery, the reindeer, or the elves (are elves human?) was quite well done. 

Perhaps the best review I can provide is that after I watched the Polar Express, I just felt happier.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005110/","name":"Ashton Kutcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Family Stone
Die Familie Stone – Verloben verboten!
programme.desc:
The Family Stone: Directed by Thomas Bezucha. With Claire Danes, Diane Keaton, Rachel McAdams, Dermot Mulroney. An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356680/","name":"The Family Stone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkwMjM4MjMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjM1OTQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356680/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"marissas75"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Talented actors have fun with a familiar premise","reviewBody":"The premise of "The Family Stone" sounds a little shopworn: Everett Stone brings his uptight girlfriend Meredith home for Christmas to meet his large family, who instantly dislike her. Even worse, the trailer reveals most of the plot's complications. However, this premise has been used so often because it reliably provides opportunities for comedy, drama, and insight into family dynamics. "The Family Stone" proves itself a better-than-average example of the genre because of its talented cast and reasonably intelligent script.

Sarah Jessica Parker's presence ensures that Meredith always remains sympathetic, even when we can also perfectly understand why she irritates the Stones. The various Stones-- Diane Keaton, Craig T. Nelson, Dermot Mulroney, Rachel McAdams, Luke Wilson--make the most of their roles, and, more importantly, they really do start to seem like a family, not a random collection of actors. The only actor who fails to make an impression is Claire Danes, who can't do much with the underwritten role of Meredith's sister Julie.

"The Family Stone" is not a groundbreaking movie, but it goes beyond the fish-out-of-water clichés that its plot might suggest. It finds the emotional truth, as well as the humor, in Meredith's situation. Plus, it's extremely evenhanded: all of the characters are flawed but likable, and in a climactic argument at the dinner table, both Meredith and Sibyl make valid points. Reviewers on this site have accused the movie of pushing a liberal agenda via its sympathetic portrayal of an interracial gay couple and a semi-bohemian family--and of pushing a conservative agenda via its portrayal of the Stones as hypocritical liberals who pay lip service to tolerance but are prejudiced against people like Meredith. Personally, I'm not sure if "The Family Stone" has any agenda, other than to cast good actors in a holiday comedy-drama that doesn't insult its audience's intelligence. programme.review: --- Actors: Claire Danes (role=Julie Morton), Diane Keaton (role=Sybil Stone), Rachel McAdams (role=Amy Stone), Dermot Mulroney (role=Everett Stone), Craig T. Nelson (role=Kelly Stone), Sarah Jessica Parker (role=Meredith Morton), Luke Wilson (role=Ben Stone), Tyrone Giordano (role=Thad Stone), Brian White (role=Patrick Thomas), Elizabeth Reaser (role=Susannah Stone Trousdale), Paul Schneider (role=Brad Stevenson), Savannah Stehlin (role=Elizabeth Trousdale)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0356680, Title: The Family Stone, --- Description: The Family Stone: Directed by Thomas Bezucha. With Claire Danes, Diane Keaton, Rachel McAdams, Dermot Mulroney. An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356680/","name":"The Family Stone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkwMjM4MjMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjM1OTQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An uptight, conservative businesswoman accompanies her boyfriend to his eccentric and outgoing family's annual Christmas celebration and finds that she's a fish out of water in their free-spirited way of life.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356680/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"marissas75","dateCreated":"2006-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Talented actors have fun with a familiar premise","reviewBody":"The premise of "The Family Stone" sounds a little shopworn: Everett Stone brings his uptight girlfriend Meredith home for Christmas to meet his large family, who instantly dislike her. Even worse, the trailer reveals most of the plot's complications. However, this premise has been used so often because it reliably provides opportunities for comedy, drama, and insight into family dynamics. "The Family Stone" proves itself a better-than-average example of the genre because of its talented cast and reasonably intelligent script.

Sarah Jessica Parker's presence ensures that Meredith always remains sympathetic, even when we can also perfectly understand why she irritates the Stones. The various Stones-- Diane Keaton, Craig T. Nelson, Dermot Mulroney, Rachel McAdams, Luke Wilson--make the most of their roles, and, more importantly, they really do start to seem like a family, not a random collection of actors. The only actor who fails to make an impression is Claire Danes, who can't do much with the underwritten role of Meredith's sister Julie.

"The Family Stone" is not a groundbreaking movie, but it goes beyond the fish-out-of-water clichés that its plot might suggest. It finds the emotional truth, as well as the humor, in Meredith's situation. Plus, it's extremely evenhanded: all of the characters are flawed but likable, and in a climactic argument at the dinner table, both Meredith and Sibyl make valid points. Reviewers on this site have accused the movie of pushing a liberal agenda via its sympathetic portrayal of an interracial gay couple and a semi-bohemian family--and of pushing a conservative agenda via its portrayal of the Stones as hypocritical liberals who pay lip service to tolerance but are prejudiced against people like Meredith. Personally, I'm not sure if "The Family Stone" has any agenda, other than to cast good actors in a holiday comedy-drama that doesn't insult its audience's intelligence. And it succeeds pretty well at that.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":65094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-02-15","keywords":"christmas,falling in love,friendship,usa,united states","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Family Stone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi468844825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Y3ODcwNWYtODYyZS00NWVmLWFhYWEtNGI5OGMxNzc2ODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143569/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174362/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080120/","name":"Thomas Bezucha"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: We're No Angels
Wir sind keine Engel
programme.desc: We're No Angels: Directed by Michael Curtiz. With Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray, Peter Ustinov, Joan Bennett. Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048801/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FjY2ViOWUtODk2Yi00NWJjLTgzYTQtOGQ2N2IxYzAwMmI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three Devil's Island escapees hide out in the house of a kindly merchant and repay his kindness by helping him and his family out of several crises.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048801/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"oftenwrong"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Top notch comedy","reviewBody":"This is one of the best comedies ever and one of my all-time favorites. I must have seen it a dozen or more times. The cast is perfect and Bogart shows he has a great talent for comedy. Rathbone plays the deliciously evil antagonist Cousin Andre, perfect in his role as the villain you love to hate which he pulls off with his usual deadpan style (has he ever played the good guy in any role?) Ustinov and Ray are perfect sidekicks for Bogart, their comedic style completely complements his. Carroll is perfect as the bumbling husband of the shop the convicts descend upon, initially planning on robbing him. I found the movie had all the necessary elements for a great side-splitting comedy along with some tender moments to show a contrast in the characters involved. I rate this one a nine of ten."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9017,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"1955-09-08","keywords":"escaped convict,christmas,based on play,devil's island,safecracker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1343602201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000007/","name":"Humphrey Bogart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001811/","name":"Peter Ustinov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712731/","name":"Aldo Ray"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002031/","name":"Michael Curtiz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Carroll is perfect as the bumbling husband of the shop the convicts descend upon, initially planning on robbing him. I found the movie had all the necessary elements for a great side-splitting comedy along with some tender moments to show a contrast in the characters involved. I rate this one a nine of ten.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9017,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"1955-09-08","keywords":"escaped convict,christmas,based on play,devil's island,safecracker","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1343602201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg0NTgzMDAtNThkMS00YTBkLThhNTktZjQ2YTcwODJjODgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000007/","name":"Humphrey Bogart","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001811/","name":"Peter Ustinov","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712731/","name":"Aldo Ray"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002031/","name":"Michael Curtiz"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

I won't give any spoilers away, but there are many GREAT things about this Christmas movie such as the set decorations, the kids acting ability are top notch, and the Christmas music is just beautiful! Sure the plot is a little like Groundhogs Day, but my kids never saw that movie, so who cares? That doesn't take away the fact that this is a fun and magical Christmas movie for anyone to enjoy who loves watching Christmas movies!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":226,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2016-12-13","keywords":"stuck in a time loop,trapped in a time loop,christmas in title,holiday in title,christmas movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Christmas All Over Again","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1643034137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4OWNiMjMtNjdiOC00ODRjLWE3YTctNDg0Mjc0M2U2OTk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4OWNiMjMtNjdiOC00ODRjLWE3YTctNDg0Mjc0M2U2OTk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Christmas All Over Again"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4051119/","name":"Sean Ryan Fox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4110566/","name":"Armani Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005579/","name":"Christy Carlson Romano"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005579/","name":"Christy Carlson Romano"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0452862/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0368398/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479478/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005579/","name":"Christy Carlson Romano"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4516611/","name":"Brendan Rooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006438/","name":"George Saunders"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas
Der Grinch
programme.desc:
How the Grinch Stole Christmas: Directed by Ron Howard. With Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Kelley, Jeffrey Tambor. On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0170016/","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNTczNzEtMjQyZC00MjFmLTkzMDMtODk4ZGMyZmE0N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the outskirts of Whoville lives a green, revenge-seeking Grinch who plans to ruin Christmas for all of the citizens of the town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0170016/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"toffeesi"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Christmas Giggles","reviewBody":"I have just read the lead comment for this film that is on the front page with the voting results and cast run down.

Why is it that some people can not take a film for what it is supposed to be.

This film is supposed to be a light hearted, tonge in cheek, family comedy, things to make the kids laugh and things for the adults, and that is exactly what this film does.

I laughed my nuts off at this film, I thought Carey put in a great performance and the whole film (if watched at Christmas) really give you a bit of festive cheer

So to all of you film reviewers stop trying to sound like film students and knock every film because it is not "Taxi Driver" or "The Godfather" and take films for what they are supposed to be, entertainment!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":223992,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2000-12-27","keywords":"christmas,dog,dr seuss,monster,the color green","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"How the Grinch Stole Christmas","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi208601113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY3N2I2MDMtNjMwYS00ZjY3LWFmODctM2E3MmQ0Njg2YTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY3N2I2MDMtNjMwYS00ZjY3LWFmODctM2E3MmQ0Njg2YTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0597410/","name":"Taylor Momsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3679189/","name":"Kelley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049831/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317450/","name":"Dr. Seuss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0696949/","name":"Jeffrey Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780620/","name":"Peter S. programme.title: The Family Man
Family Man – Eine himmlische Entscheidung
programme.desc: The Family Man: Directed by Brett Ratner. With Nicolas Cage, Téa Leoni, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Piven. A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0218967/","name":"The Family Man","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzYzMTQ4NDYtNWRkZi00NTYxLThlZDItMzI1MmU1MmU5ZWQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDA5Mjg5MjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0218967/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"whynotbacritic"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's A Wonderful Life in 2000","reviewBody":"I found this movie to be a very nice remix of "It's a Wonderful Life", much like "You've got Mail" is a remix of "Pride and Prejudice" (and totally hints at this within the film). A classic film to make you reexamine your own life, and think about what is really important and meaningful for you, what is success and happiness? Young dreamers in love with their successful careers instead of each other, find out that maybe their love really was meant to be. This is what Nicholas Cage finds out, and when he wakes up from the dream of what 'could have been', he rushes to stop 'loosing her' again, and hopefully still live the happily ever after dream. Nicholas Cage provides a stunning and comical performance in character, from the aggressive businessman - big business and small business - to a loving father and husband with his charming sense of humor. Quite a romantic film to watch with that 'someone special' during the holidays."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107083,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-09-12","keywords":"christmas,parallel universe,career man,reflection,crisis of conscience","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi318685465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711840/","name":"Brett Ratner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0224606/","name":"David Diamond"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919289/","name":"David Weissman"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. programme.title: Jack Frost
Jack Frost – Der coolste Dad der Welt
programme.desc:
Jack Frost: Directed by Troy Miller. With Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross, Mark Addy. A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0141109/","name":"Jack Frost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE4YWIzNjItZWNhNi00Y2E1LTgyODktMTUzM2ZkMmJlNDFlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzYzMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0141109/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lee B"},"dateCreated":"2000-05-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I admit it, I cried . . .","reviewBody":"Sorry everyone, but I liked this movie. I even cried at the end. My kids freaked when the snowman started to talk and move - one of them got scared by a guy in a teddy bear suit when she was about 3, and she hasn't got over it yet (2 yrs later). They had loved the start of the movie, with the snowball fight and building the first snowman, but as soon as the second snowman came to life we had to turn the video off.

I couldn't believe in Kelly Preston as the mother of an 11-yr-old boy, but in spite of that the casting was great. And Michael Keaton with blond hair is such a hunk . . .

Give it a go!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35136,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,movie flop,altered version of studio logo,jack frost character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jack Frost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3282567449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000474/","name":"Michael Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000593/","name":"Kelly Preston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189200/","name":"Joseph Cross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003474/","name":"Troy Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425756/","name":"Mark Steven Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089237/","name":"Steve Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731271/","name":"Jonathan Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Polar Express
Der Polarexpress
programme.desc:
The Polar Express: Directed by Robert Zemeckis. With Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis, Eddie Deezen, Nona Gaye. On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sak007"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Should become a holiday classic","reviewBody":"A simple story . . . beautifully told . . . magnificently visualized.

The IMAX experience was stunning.

I did not expect to enjoy the story as much as I did. Simple but quite heartwarming.

Although it started a bit slow, it continued to gain momentum (no train analogy intended) through its conclusion. I was not a great lover of the animation of the human characters, but the other animation, whether it be the train, the scenery, the reindeer, or the elves (are elves human?) was quite well done. 

Perhaps the best review I can provide is that after I watched the Polar Express, I just felt happier.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338348/","name":"The Polar Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NTU0NTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the spirit of Christmas.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338348/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sak007","dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Should become a holiday classic","reviewBody":"A simple story . . . beautifully told . . . magnificently visualized.

The IMAX experience was stunning.

I did not expect to enjoy the story as much as I did. Simple but quite heartwarming.

Although it started a bit slow, it continued to gain momentum (no train analogy intended) through its conclusion. I was not a great lover of the animation of the human characters, but the other animation, whether it be the train, the scenery, the reindeer, or the elves (are elves human?) was quite well done. 

Perhaps the best review I can provide is that after I watched the Polar Express, I just felt happier.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-12-22","keywords":"santa claus character,christmas movie,male protagonist,based on children's book,train engineer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Polar Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2954167065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI3MjkxZTctMTUzYy00MzJjLWE0OTUtMWI0MDM3NTE3MDdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy's fantastical train journey to the North Pole","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178875/","name":"Chris Coppola","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005052/","name":"Michael Jeter"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036807/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036575/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885575/","name":"Chris Van Allsburg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000709/","name":"Robert Zemeckis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115310/","name":"William Broyles Jr."],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="
