programme.title: Elf
Buddy – Der Weihnachtself
programme.desc: Elf: Directed by Jon Favreau. With Will Ferrell, James Caan, Bob Newhart, Ed Asner. Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0319343/","name":"Elf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUxNzkzMzQtYjIxZC00NzU0LThkYTQtZjNhNTljMTA1MDA1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raised as an over-sized elf, a human travels from the North Pole to NYC to meet his biological father who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0319343/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"george.schmidt"},"dateCreated":"2003-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An instant holiday classic: Ferrell's crowning achievement to date!","reviewBody":"ELF (2003) *** 1/2 Will Ferrell, James Caan, Mary Steenburgen, Edward Asner, Bob Newhart, Zooey Daschanel, Daniel Tay, Amy Sedaris, Faizon Love, Andy Richter, Kyle Gass, Michael Lerner, Artie Lange, Peter Billingsley, Peter Dinklage, Claire Lautier, Jon Favreau. Ferrell gives an inspired lunacy turn as a man who was raised by elves at The North Pole and discovers to his dismay he's actually human sparking his quest to be re-united with his long-lost father (Caan in an inspired bit of casting), a 'naughty-list' occupant, who works as a children's book publisher in New York City, just in time for Christmas. Hysterically funny thanks to the goofy yet sweet and wonderful turn by Ferrell (no one else could pull off the razor's edge of looking like an idiot yet retaining the innocent glee of a child and bares a striking resemblance to Tom Hanks' turn in 'BIG') with a great cast especially the beguilingly pretty Daschanel as his fellow Santa's Little Helper at Gimbels'who he falls in love with. Directed with style and witty warmth by Favreau (who has a cameo) and written by newcomer David Berenbaum with a smart, fun script that caters to all ages with a nostalgic nod to classic animated holiday specials for good measure. An instant holiday classic. Trivia note: Billingsley, best known as Ralphie from the yuletide cinematic classic, plays 'A CHRISTMAS STORY' the elf foreman!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":245772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-06-16","keywords":"elf,christmas,father son relationship,santa claus,christmas movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Elf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4112665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTI0MjU1ZjEtM2ExNS00YWJkLWJmMmMtOGIzMzM0ZTMwZWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001001/","name":"James Caan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627878/","name":"Bob Newhart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269463/","name":"Jon Favreau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031707/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1183854/","name":"David Berenbaum"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fack ju Göhte 3
Fack Ju Göhte 3
programme.desc:
Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mrpanda-00412"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable, but nowhere as good as the first two movies","reviewBody":"This is the third part of a trilogy and as such the novelty of the scenario is fading. The first movie was surprisingly good and not as expected. The second movie played in an entirely different environment which added a few new elements to the story. Now the third movie's setting is back where it all started: at school.

To me it seemed like the movie does not really know what it wants to do. In the first two movies, the main protagonist (the ex-con teacher) gradually opened up to the children, became friendlier, and started to care for them. This movie reboots the whole thing by making our guy dislike the children at first, only to let him warm up throughout the movie once more. In general the movie seems to re-establish many things for viewers who have not seen the first two movies. The same thing goes for the jokes, which are very similar to the two previous movies, too similar even. Overall I just felt like the two movies never happened and we are seeing more or less the same thing again. Maybe this is why the first half-hour of the movie also seemed a bit like not having a clear purpose at all. The movie wants to establish the situation, but not really. It wants to continue where the predecessors left off, but not really. It throws around jokes that are not new, really.

The second part of the movie gets more interesting and starts following a clearer story-line, albeit in a linear and predictable way. This is not unsurprising for a comedy, but compared to the predecessors it is just not as good.

If you truly enjoyed the first two movies, you will still like this one. If you did not care for the first two movies, this one is definitely not for you. It suffers from exactly the same problems as similar trilogies at the point of the third installment. Take Despicable Me for example. Not a bad movie, just nothing new and no surprises for the viewer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Unfinished Business
Big Business – Ausser Spesen nichts gewesen
programme.desc:
Unfinished Business: Directed by Ken Scott. With Vince Vaughn, Tom Wilkinson, Dave Franco, Sienna Miller. A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2358925/","name":"Unfinished Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwYjc3ZWEtNjMxNS00MzdkLWEwYWQtYWRkMDUwZWRhMjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maclock"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing","reviewBody":"Unfinished Business was a welcome surprise. Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. If I were to guess, then some of the reviewers here may have felt discomfort over the depictions of drinking, drug use, and sexuality in this picture. So it goes. Recommended viewing for the non-church going set."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-08","keywords":"male nudity,business trip,company,glory hole,businessman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415687705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable - and unimaginable - way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2002649/","name":"Dave Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779433/","name":"Ken Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175726/","name":"Steve Conrad"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"maclock","dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing","reviewBody":"Unfinished Business was a welcome surprise. Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. If I were to guess, then some of the reviewers here may have felt discomfort over the depictions of drinking, drug use, and sexuality in this picture. So it goes. programme.title: Vorwärts immer
Vorwärts Immer
programme.desc:
Vorwärts immer!: Directed by Francis Meletzky. With Jörg Schüttauf, Josefine Preuß, Jacob Matschenz, Hedi Kriegeskotte. Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use force to crush the Leipzig Monday demonstration in the evening. To protect his pregnant daughter Anne, who wants to get forged papers for her escape from the republic in Leipzig, of all days, Otto comes up with a daring plan: disguised as Honecker, he wants to withdraw the order to shoot. The opportunity is good because the real head of state is out hunting all day. Others also want to use his absence: Crown Prince Krenz and Stasi chief Mielke, who are secretly preparing a change of power in the Central Committee. The putschists are all the more astonished when they suddenly see Honecker in front of them. Otto plays the role of his life - but unfortunately the unexpected appearance of Margot, the secret ruler of the workers 'and peasants' state, thwarted his plans at the last minute. Meanwhile, the Stasi is on the heels of his daughter and her contact August, who is secretly filming for western television. And Anne has someone else on her cheek: her jealous friend Matti. He wants to dissuade her from her escape plans - and above all to pull away from August." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5307194/","name":"Vorwärts immer!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQyMzlkOTQtNDA0ZS00NWY0LTgxMGMtMWFiYTE1NDYwYmZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use for","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5307194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sheilabee-52230"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's true. You need to know the era.","reviewBody":"Having said that, if you do know it then it is a ridiculously funny film.

I'm a non-german but with ties to the GDR and I lived in the BRD for years. I'm amazed how they (all involved) carried it off so 'convincingly', the whole sound and feel of the film. I've just watched it again mainly because there wasn't much else on that evening, given covid and all. I'm so glad I did. I'd forgotten quite how silly it is and I really needed a good laugh.

It takes away nothing of the hard and serious times people were going through. It doesn't make a mockery of them. It's target is the party/state centre. I'm aware that I'm repeating most of what another reviewer has already said, but it wants saying again. This film is worth seeing because it's a funny film and because, whilst I understand there are many who might not want to be reminded of the period, we need to remember it. And we may as well be laughing when we do it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-12","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0778335/","name":"Jörg Schüttauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559326/","name":"Jacob Matschenz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577641/","name":"Francis Meletzky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201642/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550656/","name":"Markus Thebe"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1114740, Title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop, --- Description: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski","dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2263115/","name":"Raini Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895150/","name":"Eduardo Verástegui"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275698/","name":"Andy Fickman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Verpiss Dich, Schneewittchen
programme.desc: Verpiss Dich, Schneewittchen: Directed by Cüneyt Kaya. With Josefine Preuß, Nilam Farooq, Kida Khodr Ramadan, Burak Yigit. Piss off, Snow White." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5872472/","name":"Verpiss Dich, Schneewittchen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmZmOTFlZmYtNzBiNC00N2FlLWIwM2YtMDcxNzVlYmUxYzc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Piss off, Snow White.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5872472/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Snow White this isn't","reviewBody":"I did not know anything about this movie before I started watching it - apart from the title that is and the fact this is a comedy. I also think I recognize the main actor as a standup comedian. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too. This may just float your boat, if you're in the mood for it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":274,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2018-03-29","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985619737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2977411/","name":"Nilam Farooq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1391248/","name":"Kida Khodr Ramadan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2677390/","name":"Cüneyt Kaya"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070505/","name":"Rainer Bender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2651653/","name":"Mathias Brod"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3429606/","name":"Stefan Höh"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
Hangover 2
programme.desc: The Hangover Part II: Directed by Todd Phillips. With Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha. Two years after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1411697/","name":"The Hangover Part II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2MTM4MzY2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ3NzI4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two years after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1411697/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lolabeningfield"},"dateCreated":"2011-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Re-hashing of Old Material","reviewBody":"I was really optimistic going into the theatre, I didn't expect it to as great as the original, but I thought it would still be good movie. But most of the material was stuff taken from the original only tweaked, and I hate to say it but I was actually bored for a good part of the movie. Some of the jokes/scenes dragged to long, to the point where I didn't find them funny anymore. There were some good moments, but the truly outrageous/original scenes that made the original so great were too few and far between. Some of the scenes were more outrageous in the sense that there was some full frontal nudity, but I'm not someone who finds that super entertaining. Overall it felt to me like a re-hash of stuff that had already been done with some naked people thrown in, and it just wasn't enjoyable like the first movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":480421,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-05-26","keywords":"wedding,strip club,pubic hair,hangover,bachelor party","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Hangover: Part II - Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2196348185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExOTE0Njc0MDFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDUzNjU0MjMx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExOTE0Njc0MDFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDUzNjU0MjMx._V1_.jpg","description":"Phil, Stu, Alan and Doug travel to Bangkok for Stu's wedding. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177896/","name":"Bradley Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0302108/","name":"Zach Galifianakis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680846/","name":"Todd Phillips"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0221959/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563301/","name":"Craig Mazin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035905/","name":"Scot Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680846/","name":"Todd Phillips"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Le meilleur reste à venir

programme.title: La Belle Époque
Die Schönste Zeit unseres Lebens
programme.desc: La Belle Époque: Directed by Nicolas Bedos. With Daniel Auteuil, Guillaume Canet, Doria Tillier, Fanny Ardant. A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9172422/","name":"La Belle Époque","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTMzZjA2ZmMtZWMyMS00MWMxLTljYjktMWUzYjE0ZWNiY2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9172422/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DoctorStrabismus"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clever, witty, dream-like, surreal, and excellent","reviewBody":"My own personal 'Belle Époque' would have been my student days in the late 60s, most especially '69, when I fell amazingly in love, so I was 5 years ahead of Victor, but I can so much identify with the nostalgia, and the desire to go back. Indeed, I often visit those days in my dreams, with the sort of distortion of events that only dreams can do. So if I could pay to be magically transformed completely to 1969, to live its fabulous intensity all over again, only my bank balance would hold me back. To return to relive a time when the world lay ahead of me, everything seemed possible, and I was not old and cynical, now wouldn't that be marvellous? It is so refreshing to watch a movie that involves genuine acting, and Daniel Auteuil is magnificent, as always, his eyes alone capable of expressing so much emotion. And it sets 21st century and possibly futuristic technology against a backdrop of 1974, when life really was all so much simpler. The movie does at times become dream-like in its depiction of Victor's recreation of his youthful journey, and most certainly surreal, definitely bewildering in places for him, and the whole story is cleverly handled with wit and elegance. Well worth seeing, and I will give it a faultless 10/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13896,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2019-11-06","keywords":"husband wife relationship,husband wife conflict,dinner,actor,actress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3931160345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc4YzEzNTYtMzVkOC00NDlmLWI0ODItNTliODNlOWRmOGIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc4YzEzNTYtMzVkOC00NDlmLWI0ODItNTliODNlOWRmOGIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0133899/","name":"Guillaume Canet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3723133/","name":"Doria Tillier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267707/","name":"Nicolas Bedos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070074/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410559/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267707/","name":"Nicolas Bedos"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Barb and Star Go to Vista Del Mar
Barb and Star Go to Vista Del Mar
programme.desc: Barb and Star Go to Vista Del Mar: Directed by Josh Greenbaum. With Reyn Doi, Adrian Makala, Patrick Bristow, Jamie Dornan. Lifelong friends Barb and Star embark on the adventure of a lifetime when they decide to leave their small Midwestern town for the first time - ever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3797512/","name":"Barb and Star Go to Vista Del Mar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQ2OGU1OTgtYmVhYi00MGIxLTg4MzQtYWFlZjIxYTViOTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lifelong friends Barb and Star embark on the adventure of a lifetime when they decide to leave their small Midwestern town for the first time - ever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3797512/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nancyldraper"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Therapeutic Silliness","reviewBody":"If you are looking for a completely silly movie, then, look no further. If you need a giggle or a sudden explosive laugh, it's here. Absurd, preposterous, farcical, ludicrous. It's therapeutic. I needed it, so, I give this film a 7 (cathartic) out of 10. {Comedy}","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13503,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2021-02-12","keywords":"singing on a bicycle,location in title,midwestern accent,female friendship,florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi845791513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI2ZDYxYWItOTUzZS00MmI1LWIzMjktMTllMDRjZWM0MzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI2ZDYxYWItOTUzZS00MmI1LWIzMjktMTllMDRjZWM0MzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Take a trip and break out of your shell with Barb and Star. Lifelong friends Barb and Star embark on the adventure of a lifetime when they decide to leave their small Midwestern town for the first time…ever. Competition between the maid of honor and a bridesmaid, over who is the bride's best friend, threatens to upend the life of an out-of-work pastry chef." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1478338/","name":"Bridesmaids","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyOTMyMzUxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI4MzE0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Competition between the maid of honor and a bridesmaid, over who is the bride's best friend, threatens to upend the life of an out-of-work pastry chef.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1478338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tvtiguy"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Terrible","reviewBody":"This movie is terrible. Rudolph is good (as she is in everything) but everything else is contrived nonsense. I heard it was a "girl's The Hangover" - but that couldn't be farther from the truth (except that they ripped characters and plot lines from The Hangover). 

At least in The Hangover you could suspend your disbelief while you were watching the film. In hindsight, some it seems ridiculous, but almost all of the comic elements of this film are completely ridiculous. For example - the roommate brother/sister team? No one believes there are any humans on the planet like that. Every time they were on the screen it took me completely away from the film.

programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_QL75_UX190_CR0,0,190,281_.jpg

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
Die Hexen von Eastwick
programme.desc: The Witches of Eastwick: Directed by George Miller. With Jack Nicholson, Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer. Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094332/","name":"The Witches of Eastwick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4ZGRlNDEtNDliMi00NmI0LThlYjctYmViMjI0MDlmOWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"smatysia"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this!","reviewBody":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this! He really hams it up here. Very good supporting work by Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfieffer, and Veronica Cartwright. The plot is a little bit impenetrable. The "witches" are at first unaware of their power. I suppose I should read Updike's novel, but the one book of his I did read sucked. Anyway, I recommend the film, for it seems a bit different than normal Hollywood formula.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66970,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1987-06-12","keywords":"divorced woman,windstorm,verbose speech,1980s,hand on woman's butt","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Witches of Eastwick","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2046165273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWYzMmFiZDItMTRkYS00ZDZhLTljZDAtZTI4M2Y3NDJlMjBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWYzMmFiZDItMTRkYS00ZDZhLTljZDAtZTI4M2Y3NDJlMjBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Warner Bros. programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
Hot Tub – Der Whirlpool ... ist 'ne verdammte Zeitmaschine!
programme.desc: Hot Tub Time Machine: Directed by Steve Pink. With John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson, Rob Corddry. A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1231587/","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjExODA4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYwMDYxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1231587/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in time","reviewBody":"Not an instant classic, but a lot of fun to watch. I think you can summarize it like that. The main actors are doing a great job selling the very silly idea of time traveling with or rather inside a hot tub! If you get sucked into that, everything else will work too. But if you don't like that general idea ... Maybe you shouldn't watch the movie after all and save yourself the time (and grief).\n\nIt's hilarious and it has heart, even when it's gross at times. Which it can be, but it's easy to tolerate and forgive it for those little moments, because it actually is funny. Trying to figure out how it actually works (the physics of the time travel) would probably lead into a territory the movie would not want you to go ... and why would you want to ruin your own enjoyment ... if you're having fun watching - stick with it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2010-03-26","keywords":"bare breasts,ski resort,cheating wife,promiscuous woman,casual sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1318257689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four guys travel back to their respective 80s heydays thanks to a time-bending hot tub."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1117791/","name":"Rob Corddry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0732497/","name":"Craig Robinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684336/","name":"Steve Pink"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079035/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372222/","name":"Josh Heald"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Trying to figure out how it actually works (the physics of the time travel) would probably lead into a territory the movie would not want you to go ... and why would you want to ruin your own enjoyment ... if you're having fun watching - stick with it","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2010-03-26","keywords":"bare breasts,ski resort,cheating wife,promiscuous woman,casual sex","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1318257689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four guys travel back to their respective 80s heydays thanks to a time-bending hot tub.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1117791/","name":"Rob Corddry","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0732497/","name":"Craig Robinson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684336/","name":"Steve Pink"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079035/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372222/","name":"Josh Heald","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black 3
Men in Black 3
programme.desc:
Men in Black 3: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, Jemaine Clement. Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1409024/","name":"Men in Black 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NTYxODcwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NDY0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J travels in time to M.I.B.'s early days in 1969 to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1409024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"3xHCCH"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Josh Brolin Played a Perfect Tommy Lee Jones","reviewBody":"I am not exactly a Will Smith fan. I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K. As J goes back to the past, he will interact with the young 29-year old K, perfectly played by Josh Brolin. Brolin amazingly captures the laconic persona, and even the distinct voice, of Jones so well that they seemed to have been one and the same actor. It was also good to see Emma Thompson again in a major film as she portrayed Agent O, another senior agent with a soft spot for K. The younger Agent O was played by a cutie named Alice Eve, but she certainly did not convince us that she would look or act like Emma Thompson when she grows older.

I must say that this film was really a most entertaining one. Well, maybe more for me than for my kids. Younger audiences may find the jokes about 1969 cultural references, such as the hippies, the racial tension, etc., to be a bit difficult to grasp. But the fun action sequences with some exciting futuristic vehicles and weaponry, the imaginative and repulsive aliens made by no less than the master monster-maker Rick Baker, the thrilling integration of the historic Apollo 11 lift-off, and the touching revelation of K's big secret made this a very good and enjoyable movie to watch. 3D did not seem necessary. Director Barry Sonnenfeld got it right this time, and this segment certainly gave perfect closure to the story arc of the whole series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348757,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2012-05-25","keywords":"escape from prison,neil armstrong character,alien,time travel,cape canaveral florida","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3916407065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIzNzE5MjU5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ5NTEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J time-jumps back to the year 1969 to take out an alien with its sights on the younger version of Agent K -- a situation that poses a threat to the future of the MIB organization, and humankind's very existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000982/","name":"Josh Brolin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

I think the last Will Smith film I watched and liked was the first "Men in Black" film back in 1997. I was surprised to learn that there will be another installment of "Men in Black" this year, the third of the series. The second MiB was shown in 2002, and I did not even care to finish that one. Will the ten years between the last episode and this one make a difference? I needed to see that.

In this film, a vicious alien villain known as Boris the Animal escapes from his prison on the moon, where he had been locked up since being arrested by Agent K (Tommy Lee Jones) back in 1969. One day, Agent K disappears from the present day. His partner Agent J (Will Smith) realizes that K had been assassinated by Boris forty years ago, which caused a major change of events, allowing Boris' alien race to overrun the Earth. J had to find a way to travel back in time to 1969 in order to save K and rectify the tragic consequences of his death. Can J save K and in turn save the Earth from the clutches of Boris?

The odd couple was just as they were before in the first films. Will Smith is still his old loudmouth Agent J as Tommy Lee Jones was his tight-lipped Agent K.
